intro: Astracantha microptera, commonly known as the narrow-winged milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant produces a milky sap that is toxic, which serves as a defense mechanism against herbivores. Its leaves are opposite and oval-shaped, with a hairy texture. Astracantha microptera typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas.
